metadata.title: CVE-2024-27436 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ALSA:usb-audio: Stop parsing channels bits when all channels are found. If a usbaudio device sets more bits than the amount of channels it could writeoutside of the map array.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-lowlatency - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1133-azure - 5.4.0-1133.140~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1132-gcp - 5.4.0-1132.141~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1075-ibm - 5.4.0-1075.80~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1127-oracle - 5.4.0-1127.136~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-230.242').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1157.162').
linux-aws package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1174.187').
